from A &

>
we're seriously thinking of it. my problem is the autoimmune deal
which makes my energy a bit unpredictible. so it's tentative

-susan
austin,tx

messages.messageBody:
Hi Susan ...

yes, I know about this ... Feast (our h-s bookstore) is co-sponsoring this
so it should be a lot of fun ... some h-s friends of ours are attending but
we arent' b/c it's scheduled during our anniv/(my) b-day week, so we'll be
out of town during that time ... are you attending??? WOW h-s'rs from A &
H; it'll be WILD won't it??? oh well, next time, better planning ...

Pris

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Austin???
messages.msgSnippet: san antonio is a pretty city.  by any chance are you planning on going to schlitternbahn aqua lab the third week of  august?  it s a sort of homeschool event
messages.messageBody:
san antonio is a pretty city. by any chance are you planning on going
to schlitternbahn aqua lab the third week of august? it's a sort of
homeschool event when they discount admission i think $15.25
(incl.tx)/person 3+,- this conincides w/the start of ps. a bunch of
hsers from here and houston are planning on going on the 16th (wed).
it should be fun.

-susan
austin,tx


> Susan??? I didn't know you're from Austin??? goodness, we're almost
> neighbors!!! we're outside of San Antonio ...
>
> Pris ~> who'll bleed BURNT ORANGE if she's pricked, HOOK~EM HORNS!!!
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: susan wilson <fxfireob@...>
> To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
> Sent: Thursday, June 29, 2000 5:32 PM
> Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Can you suggest some books?
>
>
>
> hi,
>
> sudbury has some good reading on their free texts link at
> http://www.sudval.org/
> here are some other sites you might find interesting:
> *Paths of Learning http://www.pathsoflearning.com/
> We aim to inspire parents, educators, and others interested in
educational
> policy and practice to consider diverse ways in which children and
adults
> can gain meaningful, integrated knowledge and develop their own
authentic
> potentials.
> *thinkers http://www.infed.org/thinkers/default.htm
> These pages explore the contributions of some of the thinkers
central to
> the development of the theory and practice of lifelong learning and
> informal education.
>
> -susan
> austin,tx
>
>
>
>> The Sudbury Valley Schools have proven, over a 30-year period and
with
> hundreds of kids,
>> that the total sum of mathematics learning in the usual k-12 school
can
> be
>> taught, all of it, in 8 weeks, when the child is ready and
contracts to
> do so. The
>> evidence is there, we just have to become more comfortable working
with
> it.
>>
>> Enjoy the list!
>>
>> David
>>
>
>
